applicability_reasoning: This regulation (Section 83) specifically addresses conditions under which regulated entities can opt out of displaying warning statements in advertisements. The document provided is a comprehensive pension scheme rules document that outlines the terms, conditions, and operational details of a pension life cover scheme. It is not an advertisement - rather, it is a formal legal/contractual document that establishes and governs the scheme. The document contains detailed definitions, scheme operations, benefits, trustee duties, and administrative procedures. While the document is from a regulated entity (AIB life), this particular regulation about advertisement warning statements is not relevant to this type of document. The document's purpose is to serve as scheme rules rather than to advertise or promote financial services.
regulation_title: Option not to display warning statements in limited circumstances
regulation_text: 83. A regulated entity may opt not to display the warning statements required by these Regulations to be included in advertisements where the advertisement satisfies the following conditions: (a) the advertisement only specifies either or both of the following: (i) the name of the financial service; (ii) an invitation to consumers to discuss the financial service in more detail with the regulated entity; (b) the advertisement does not link to other information that forms part of the advertisement through a hyperlink referred to in Regulation 76; (c) the advertisement does not refer to any terms or conditions of the financial service as part of the name of the financial service concerned, or elsewhere, in the advertisement.
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
